alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 07 at 9:48AM CST until February 09 at 12:45AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Clarke, Washington and Choctaw Counties. For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Pastureland becomes flooded. Livestock should be moved to higher ground. Old Ferry Road near the river begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Latest tailwater stage missing. Last observation recorded was at 10:00 AM CST Sunday of 30.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Sunday was 30.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to gradually fall from a forecast of 30.5 feet today to falling below flood stage by Tuesday evening. The river is then forecast to continue falling to 19.0 feet by Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
